name: Comedy
description: Range of styles, both musical and non-musical, that always set out to make the listener laugh through humor.

sub_genres.name: Break-In
sub_genres.description: Comedy with narrator posing questions or commentary, answered with a song sample.

sub_genres.name: Dutch Cabaret
sub_genres.description: Popular comedy form in the Netherlands which evolved out of traditional Cabaret in the 1890s.

sub_genres.name: Kabarett
sub_genres.description: Theatrical entertainment consisting of mixed elements of music, sketches, monologues, dialogues, lyric poetry and/or ballads.

sub_genres.name: Musical Comedy
sub_genres.description: Heavily utilizes music in its delivery of humor.

sub_genres.name: Prank Calls
sub_genres.description: Practical jokes performed over the telephone, typically involving a comedian putting on a persona to make the individual on the other end of the line seem foolish.

sub_genres.name: Sketch Comedy
sub_genres.description: Performers assume a dramatic setting (rather than addressing the audience directly), often as fictional characters.

sub_genres.name: Stand-Up Comedy
sub_genres.description: Comedy where the performer speaks directly to their intended audience, with origins beginning in the late 19th century.
